revised_title: An Analysis of the Helvetian Concretion and Its Relation to Animal Stones
tldr: The author examines a stone sent to the Royal Society from Berne and compares its properties to those of other stones and minerals. Through a series of experiments, the author determines that the stone's specific gravity is heavier than common stones and closer to that of petrified water. The author also discusses the stone's reaction to various acids and suggests that it may contain metallic particles. This study contributes to the understanding of the nature of concretions and their relationship to animal stones.
